fgeo.tool
  • Functions Index
  • News
  • fgeo

Help read ForestGEO data with consistent column type.

This functions helps to read ForestGEO's data with consistent column types. They output the specification for the argument col_types() of the functions read_*() of the readr package:

  • type_vft(): Type specification for ViewFullTable.

  • type_taxa(): Type specification for ViewFullTaxonomy.

type_vft()

type_taxa()

Value

A list.

See also

readr::read_delim().

Examples

type_vft()
#> $DBHID
#> [1] "i"
#> 
#> $PlotName
#> [1] "c"
#> 
#> $PlotID
#> [1] "i"
#> 
#> $Family
#> [1] "c"
#> 
#> $Genus
#> [1] "c"
#> 
#> $SpeciesName
#> [1] "c"
#> 
#> $Mnemonic
#> [1] "c"
#> 
#> $Subspecies
#> [1] "c"
#> 
#> $SpeciesID
#> [1] "i"
#> 
#> $SubspeciesID
#> [1] "c"
#> 
#> $QuadratName
#> [1] "c"
#> 
#> $QuadratID
#> [1] "i"
#> 
#> $PX
#> [1] "d"
#> 
#> $PY
#> [1] "d"
#> 
#> $QX
#> [1] "d"
#> 
#> $QY
#> [1] "d"
#> 
#> $TreeID
#> [1] "i"
#> 
#> $Tag
#> [1] "c"
#> 
#> $StemID
#> [1] "i"

#> $StemNumber
#> [1] "i"
#> 
#> $StemTag
#> [1] "i"
#> 
#> $PrimaryStem
#> [1] "c"
#> 
#> $CensusID
#> [1] "i"
#> 
#> $PlotCensusNumber
#> [1] "i"
#> 
#> $DBH
#> [1] "d"
#>

#> [1] "d"

#> $Date
#> [1] "i"
